headline: Air Fryer Lobster Tails with Lemon-Garlic Butter
description: Air fry lobster tails until succulent and delicious; top with a lemon garlic butter sauce for an easy, fancy meal for two at home in just 10 minutes.
name: Air Fryer Lobster Tails with Lemon-Garlic Butter
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an air fryer to 380 degrees F (195 degrees C).

Butterfly lobster tails by cutting lengthwise through the centers of the hard top shells and meat with kitchen shears. Cut to, but not through, the bottoms of the shells. Spread tail halves apart. Place tails in the air fryer basket with lobster meat facing up.
Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add lemon zest and garlic; heat until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.

Transfer 2 tablespoons of butter mixture to a small bowl; brush this onto lobster tails. Discard any remaining brushed butter to avoid contamination from uncooked lobster. Season lobster with salt and pepper.
Cook in the preheated air fryer until lobster meat is opaque, 5 to 7 minutes.
Spoon reserved butter from the saucepan over lobster meat. Top with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

review.reviewBody: Quick, easy and tender
I will always cook lobster tails in an air fryer !! It turned out perfect!!!

This was WOW! Amazing! Basically made the butter mixture, swabbed the lobster with it, cooked for 2 min and re-applied - only to cook in the air fryer for another 5 min. This was PERFECT! Wow good! I agree - this might be the only way I make lobster moving forward. Thank you Allrecipes Team for a “holy $&&7!” Good recipe!
Cooked just under 7 minutes but should have checked at 5 minutes because they were overcooked. Dish was tasty, however.
Turned out good

I've made this several times. Oddly the recipe photo doesn't match the described process. The photo isn't showing the tails to be "butterflied", just split. For my experience butterflying the tails makes it a challenge to get the meat to leave the bottom shell. My suggestion is to split the hard upper shell then pull the meat out, close the shells and let the meat rest on top of the hard top shells. Follow the recipe from there, it's tasty and easier to eat.
DELISH..
I made two 4 oz. Lobster tails for 6 minutes, with lemon & butter slathered on. Perfect!
I loved this, next time for 2 4 os. Lobster tails cutting the time to 2 minutes per side, check and maybe 1 additional minute. So delicious easier than making in my cast iron frying pan, and no mess.
Easy and excellent. Air frying lobster tails is really good!
Highly recommend using the air fryer for "broiling" your lobster tails. Turned out great. I cut the shell lengthwise, pulled the meat away from the shell and laid it on top. Came out perfect!
Not a fan of the air fryer yet but the tails came out very soft and juicy.
I cooked my first 2 lobster tails in my Air Fryer and honey, I will be cooking them like this from now on. I luv my freakin Air Fryer!!
Oh yah! This was too easy and now my lobster tail go too!!!
Very easy to make, cake our delicious!
I'd make this again. The wife said it had great flavor and wasn't dry. The only thing I changed was the butter mixture and actually pulled the lobster from the shell and sat it in top of the shell.
I loved the recipe. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the lobster turned out tender and juicy, in the air fryer. Surprise, surprise! I will definitely make this again! My husband loved it!
It was delicious!
It came out great the taste was nice and butterier

It was delicious, and very easy to make! The hardest thing is cutting the shell. It was my very first thing making lobster. I forgot to take a picture, but hearing my husband say “Oh my God” as he tasted it was priceless. He is a very hard food critic, and with him is either hit or miss. He gave me the 4, and he says it could have been a 5 but he doesn’t know it. So I think it’s truly a 5!
Turned out way better than i thought it would. Tasted great ! Don't forget the butter and lemon.

I made it but don't agree with the time of cooking instructions. Did taste great and I like the butter, lemon, garlic topping.
Certainly will make it again.
This was excellent!! And easy as can be. I placed them in a small piece of tinfoil to hold in the butter mixture. So this added about 3 minutes to the time.
Loved this! I will never cook lobster in anything other than an air fryer again!

item.name: Air Fryer Lobster Tails with Lemon-Garlic Butter
